Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Bombinin H4  (natural AMPs; UCLL1c; toad, amphibians, XXA, XXD, animals; inactive bombinin H6)

Literature Information.Literature: Warning: The residue at position-2 is a D-amino acid (D-alloisoleucine). Note that the relative abundance of the amino acid at position 1 is Ile (58%) and Leu (42%). Position 1 is represented with I.  The second position is D-aILe, represented with I.Sequence analysis: Rich in L (30%).Activity: Active against E. coli D21 (LC 4.8 uM) and S. aureus Cowan 1(LC 3.3 uM). Active also against Gram-  Y. pseudotuberculosis YPIII (LC 8.2 uM), P. syringae pv tabaci (8.2 uM), E. agglomerans Bo-1S (11.3 uM), Gram+  B. megaterium Bm11 (0.8 uM), S. lentus (0.60 uM), M. luteus (0.2 uM), fungi C. albicans ATCC 10231 (1.6 uM), C. guiller-mondii (0.7 uM), C. tropicalis (0.6 uM) (Mangoni ML et al. 2007).Structure:  Structure was determined in SDS or DPC (Toxicon. 2008; 52(2):246-54).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.Toxicity:  highly Hemolytic (Lethal concentration 14.6 uM).(MIC data provided by Chunfeng Wang). Updated 9/2017; 3/2018; 5/2020; edited Jan2024.
Literature Information.Author: Mignogna G, Simmaco M, Kreil G, Barra D.1993
Literature Information.Title: Antibacterial and haemolytic peptides containing D-alloisoleucine from the skin of Bombina variegata.
